text.div:
Root Cause

CodeDescriptionCommentVersion
AP Analysis ProcessEnter (AP) when ANALYSIS PROCESS is the reason due to: • Product or supply failure (reagents, calibrators, QC material) • Equipment or instrumentation failureadded v2.8
IM Information ManagementEnter (IM) when INFORMATION MANAGEMENT is the reason due to: • Database or Programming issues • Overriding of test results • Inaccurate calculations • Inaccurate flagging, reference ranges, units of measure • Incomplete/inaccurate transmission of test results • Otheradded v2.8
L LaboratoryEnter (L) when LABORATORY is the reason due to: â¢ Data Entry error â¢ Testing/Technical error â¢ Repeat testing causing change to test resultadded v2.8
NA Not ApplicableEnter (NA) when NOT-APPLICABLE is the reason due to: • If no revisions performed or • unable to determine reason for revision Note: Do not use NA if result code status is not corrected (revised) or if a preliminary release of results with a correction (revision)added v2.8
PD Placer DataEnter (PD) when new or changed PLACER DATA information is the reason due to: • Changed patient demographics or • Result code data provided by the client on the requisition or specimen manifest that will be entered during order entry (i.e. Previous Biopsy Date, Clinical Information, Source, etc...)added v2.8

name: v2.0914
title: v2 Root Cause
description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0914 ( Root Cause)
